intro: Hedyotis terminalis, commonly known as the trailing strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Hedyotis terminalis is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance.
